Name: methyl formate production | methyl formate | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Methyl formate is produced by the carbonylation of methanol:;CH4O + CO --> C2H4O2;About 95 % carbon monoxide, but only about 30 % methanol is converted under the industrial reaction conditions (4.5 MPa, 80Â°C). With recirculation of the unreacted methanol, nearly quantitative conversion of methanol to methyl formate can be achieved. Therefore, a yield of 95% has been assumed.;The inventory is at least partially based on a generic model on the production of chemicals. For more information refer to the sampling procedure.;References:;Reutemann, W., Kieczka, H. (2005): Formic acid, Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Seventh Edition, Wiley-VCH.;Shouzu, Z. (2003): Production Technology and Application Foreground of Methyl;Formate, 26th vol. Policy guidance (In Chinese).
